meanings.definition: To throw or cast underhand or with less force than necessary.
meanings.sent1: She was underthrowing the ball during the game.
meanings.sent2: He always underthrows the ball when playing catch.
meanings.sent3: The magician's underthrowing of the ball made it disappear in a puff of smoke!
meanings.sent4: Her underthrowing of the ball was like a gentle breeze compared to his powerful throws.
meanings.sent5: Underthrowing the ball made it fall short of the target.

meanings.definition: The act of throwing or casting something underhand or with less force than necessary.
meanings.sent1: His underthrowing of the ball cost them the game.
meanings.sent2: The coach noticed her underthrowing during practice.
meanings.sent3: The underthrowing of the frisbee led to a hilarious game of fetch with the dog.
meanings.sent4: The underthrowing of the dart symbolized his lack of confidence in the game.
meanings.sent5: The underthrowing of the paper airplane caused it to nosedive quickly.
